java.lang.Object

public final class SesameQueryUtils
extends java.lang.Object

isDescribe

public static boolean isDescribe(org.openrdf.query.algebra.TupleExpr theExpr)

Return whether or not the TupleExpr represents a parsed describe query.

This is not foolproof and depends on the inspection of variable names in the query model. Sesame's parser uses regular names for generated variables in describe queries, so we're sniffing the model looking for these names to make an educated guess as to whether or not this represents a parsed describe query.

Parameters:
theExpr - the expression
Returns:
true if a describe query, false otherwise

rewriteDescribe

public static void rewriteDescribe(org.openrdf.query.algebra.TupleExpr theExpr)

Simplify the parsed model for a describe query.

Parameters:
theExpr - the describe algebra

theExpr - the describe algebra

escape

public static java.lang.String escape(java.lang.String theString)
Properly escape out any special characters in the query string. Replaces unescaped double quotes with \" and replaces slashes '\' which are not a valid escape sequence such as \t or \n with a double slash '\\' so they are unescaped correctly by a SPARQL parser.

Parameters:
theString - the query string to escape chars in
Returns:
the escaped query string

setLimit

public static void setLimit(org.openrdf.query.parser.ParsedQuery theQuery,
                            int theLimit)
Set the value of the limit on the query object to a new value, or specify a limit if one is not specified.

Parameters:
theQuery - the query to alter
theLimit - the new limit
